metadata.Name: MEDIA
metadata.Description: We introduce a new semantic task for the French Spoken Language Understanding (SLU) benchmark MEDIA. This task focuses on identifying the semantic role of each word in a spoken utterance, providing a more granular understanding of the utterance's meaning.
metadata.Paper Title: New Semantic Task for the French Spoken Language Understanding MEDIA Benchmark
metadata.Abstract: Spoken Language Understanding (SLU) is a core task in spoken dialogue systems. Existing French SLU benchmarks focus on intent detection and slot filling, but lack a fine-grained semantic analysis of utterances. In this paper, we introduce a new semantic task for the French SLU benchmark MEDIA. This task focuses on identifying the semantic role of each word in a spoken utterance, providing a more granular understanding of the utterance's meaning. We provide a detailed description of the task, the annotation process, and the baseline results. We show that our task is challenging and can be used to improve the performance of SLU systems.
